DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study learn effect rapid atrial pacing ( patient dual chamber pacemaker ) electrocardiogram include QT Interval . The investigator also interested difference cause gene .
DOC.brief_title: Effects Rapid Atrial Pacing Has Electrocardiogram ( ECG ) Patients With Dual Chamber Pacemakers
DOC.detailed_description: This study require total two study day well two follow visit . During study day one , baseline blood drawn , baseline electrocardiogram perform , continuous QT Interval monitoring perform . The pacemaker rate increase 90bpm different time interval additional blood drawn measure effect rate change . On study day two , baseline blood drawn , urine specimen obtain , electrocardiogram perform , continuous QT Interval monitoring perform . Following acquisition information , pacemaker rate decrease 80bpm . We obtain blood specimen , urine specimen electrocardiogram 30 minute post rate change 60 minute post rate change . Two day follow rate decrease 80bpm , patient return clinic rate decrease 70bpm . In two day , patient return final rate change 60bpm .
DOC.criteria: Must least 21 year old Must dual chamber pacemaker implant three month ago Must follow Vanderbilt University Medical Center 's Arrhythmia Device Clinic The indication pacemaker must relate coronary artery disease ( CAD ) congestive heart failure ( CHF ) Can pacemaker dependent History ventricular arrhythmia and/or implantable defibrillator ( ICDs ) History paroxysmal , persistent , permanent atrial fibrillation ( AF ) Congenital long QT syndrome History coronary artery disease History , currently receive , treatment congestive heart failure Unable tolerate dualchamber pacing ( DDD ) 90 bpm due palpitation , chest pain , shortness breath , lightheadedness , dizziness , presyncope Pregnant woman Any patient without specific documentation echocardiogram negative CHF ( systolic diastolic dysfunction ) within five year prior study enrollment Any patient without specific documentation objective diagnostic test rule CAD within five year prior study enrollment
